poem:
**Rushed Legislation**

In swift hands,  
the edifice shakes—  
a promise of gold crumbles  
into whispers of caution.  
Party lines  
bend and thrum,  
an unheard melody  
of consequence.  
The papers skim  
troubled waters,  
while the streets  
wait, listening  
for an echoing step  
that never lands.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The Guardian view on Labour’s welfare mess: attempting to hide its cuts triggered a rebellion too big to punish | Editorial In 2022, Liz Truss’s mini-budget collapsed under the weight of its own ideological haste, destroying her government’s credibility in days. Whether the debacle over Labour’s welfare reform bill will leave a similarly lasting mark on the Starmer administration remains uncertain. But the signs are familiar: rushed legislation, party unrest and proposals out of step". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: The Guardian view on Labour’s welfare mess: attempting to hide its cuts triggered a rebellion too big to punish | Editorial In 2022, Liz Truss’s mini-budget collapsed under the weight of its own ideological haste, destroying her government’s credibility in days. Whether the debacle over Labour’s welfare reform bill will leave a similarly lasting mark on the Starmer administration remains uncertain. But the signs are familiar: rushed legislation, party unrest and proposals out of step
